inference:
Using the Law of Sines on triangle ABC, we have
$$\frac{BC}{\sin A} = \frac{AB}{\sin C}$$
$$BC = \frac{AB \sin A}{\sin C}$$
$$BC = \frac{20 \sin 30^\circ}{\sin 45^\circ}$$
Since $\sin 30^\circ = \frac{1}{2}$ and $\sin 45^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}$,
$$BC = \frac{20 \cdot \frac{1}{2}}{\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}} = \frac{20}{2} \cdot \frac{2}{\sqrt{2}} = 10 \sqrt{2}$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{10 \sqrt{2}}$
